description.value: Nicer defines the side of a paired organ or side of the body on which the reportable cancer originated. See **Laterality (Variable number: 3.8)** in \'E A Struktur der Basisdaten.pdf\' (https://www.nicer.org/de/krebsregistrierung/krebsregistrierung-nach-krg-ab-112020/).

definition.value: Unilateral, but unknown whether right or left.

Origin of primary tumour is on both sides of a paired organ (when tumours of the same morphology are diagnosed simultaneously in both sides of a paired organ). Bilateral cancers are very rare, e.g. bilateral retinoblastoma, bilateral Wilms tumour of the kidney, or both ovaries involved simultaneously.
It is unknown whether, for a paired organ, the origin of the cancer was on the left or right side of the body.
